name: Springhill Suites by Marriott St. Petersburg/Clearwater

reviews.title: Great Stay!
reviews.text: This hotel opened in early 2006. Its wonderful. It was my first stay at a SpringHills suites (owned by Marriott). The rooms are really nice because it has a living area (microwave, fridge, sink) and couch/chairs seperated from the sleeping area by a half wall. This is great if you have a little one sleeping in a crib or pack-n-play that you want sperated from you. Its not much bigger than a regular room (maybe 30%) but feels much bigger.

I stayed here on a combination business trip/family visit. I stayed at this hotel in order to do a site inspection for an upcoming business meeting. The hotel staff did not know that I was there to "check them out" as I wanted to experience the hotel as the meeting participants would - as an average traveller. I was intending to book a meeting room for our regional sales meeting in early October, about 18 people.The rooms are fairly new and the noise from outside is not that bad although you can certainly hear the jets from the airport landing/taking off. The free breakfast in the morning is fine.
reviews.title: Not Coming Back

reviews.text: My decision not to book my meeting here, however, is because the staff seemed inexperienced in dealing with guest issues. This inexperience, combined with a confrontational and argumentative attitude made me decide to book my meeting at another hotel in the area.
reviews.title: Room Appeared Brand New

reviews.text: I am sorry to say that in spite of the things that this property might have going for it, I will not be giving them any more business.
reviews.title: Excellent Business Stay!

reviews.text: Stayed three days. The nicely furnished room seemed new. Air condition ran quiet on a low cool. Lighting excellent if you need to read or work on a laptop. The living room included a desk and chair as well as sofa and tables. There is a small kitchen with mini fridge and excellent lighting. There was nothing super special about the pool, whirlpool and small fitness room. The treadmill was okay for a two-mile run in the morning before breakfast. Hated the so-called buffet breakfast at this particular location. There is a large flat screen TV off from the lobby along with a computer and printer. Overall, good location if you need to be near Tampa and St Pete.
reviews.title: Clean, modern, great value.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Springhill Suites two nights in September 2006 while on buisness. The staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel and rooms were very clean and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast buffet in the lobby was tastey and very convenient! I would definitely stay at Springhill Suites again - for business or pleasure!
reviews.title: Excellent Value for your money

likes.disliked: — The date palm bug that came into our room.

aka: Springhill Suites By Marriott St. Petersburg/Clearwater Hotel
description: The Springhill Suites Clearwater, located between the gulf beaches and Tampa Bay, is the hotel designed to pamper you with conveniences and value. Many major companies are just around the corner such as Raymond James, Cardinal Health, Franklin Templeton and Regions Bank.
